ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Retrocochlear pathology
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Significant deterioration in right ear Word Recognition Score (88% to 56%) and slight threshold asymmetry.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Sensorineural hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Bilateral sloping hearing loss is present, though the asymmetry suggests a retrocochlear component.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess hearing thresholds and compare with previous evaluation.
To assess speech understanding and check for retrocochlear signs (rollover or asymmetry).
To assess the acoustic reflex pathway for retrocochlear pathology.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Audiometry reveals bilateral sloping sensorineural hearing loss, with the right ear showing a slight threshold decrease at 2000 and 3000 Hz compared to prior tests. Crucially, there is a significant deterioration in the right ear Word Recognition Score (from 88% to 56%), while the left ear remains stable. Tympanometry is normal bilaterally. Acoustic reflexes are absent at higher frequencies, consistent with the hearing loss, and decay is negative. The findings raise concern for retrocochlear pathology.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Normal to slight SNHL (250-1000 Hz) sloping to severe (3000-8000 Hz). Left ear: Normal to slight SNHL (250-2000 Hz) sloping to severe. Right ear shows slight decrease at 2000 and 3000 Hz compared to prior.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear WRS 56% (poor, significantly decreased from previous 88%). Left ear WRS 86% (good). SRTs agree with PTA.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Present at 500 and 1000 Hz; absent at 2000 and 4000 Hz bilaterally. Reflex decay negative at 500 and 1000 Hz.

counseling_actions: Confirm that hearing aids are functioning correctly and are not the cause of reduced clarity
Explain the significant change in speech understanding in the right ear
Discuss the need for medical evaluation to rule out retrocochlear pathology

red_flags_present: Significant asymmetry in Word Recognition Scores
Unexplained asymmetric progression of hearing loss

escalation.rationale_short: To rule out retrocochlear pathology due to significant deterioration in right ear WRS.

follow_up_plan.objective: ENT evaluation and ABR testing to investigate potential retrocochlear pathology.
